# videoRotationAngle

**Instance Property**

A rotation angle the connection applies to a video flowing through it.

## Declaration

```swift
var videoRotationAngle: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

Your app can set a video rotation angle that it gets from an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/RotationCoordinator] instance’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/RotationCoordinator/videoRotationAngleForHorizonLevelCapture] or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/RotationCoordinator/videoRotationAngleForHorizonLevelPreview] property. The rotation angle only applies to video or depth connections, similar to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureConnection/isVideoMirrored], and can be any angle that [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureConnection/isVideoRotationAngleSupported(_:)] returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for.

Not all capture connections rotate each frame. For example, a video connection to an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput] or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCapturePhotoOutput] instance applies a rotation with a QuickTime track matrix or with EXIF tags, respectively.

Capture connections to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutput] and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDepthDataOutput] instances rotate video frames they provide to their [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutputSampleBufferDelegate/captureOutput(_:didOutput:from:)] and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDepthDataOutputDelegate/depthDataOutput(_:didOutput:timestamp:connection:)] delegate methods, respectively. Each [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutput] instance uses hardware acceleration to rotate every frame.



You can rotate the video of a movie file you record with an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriter] instance by applying the rotation to an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriterInput] instance’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriterInput/transform] property. This approach avoids the performance costs that come with rotating each video frame.



## Rotating a video

- **isVideoRotationAngleSupported(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the connection supports a rotation angle.
